column4: help! ubuntu isn't letting me back-up a folder with a bunch of .doc and .odt files to my server! it's telling me I don't have permission for each one of the files I try to upload! what can I do?
Try opening the ftp program as root
or nautilus for that matter
whatever you use to copy
how do I do that? (plus, it's not an ftp program, it's a local network server, so it opens like a normal folder on my computer)
try gksudo nautilus
it will open another window, and use that for copying and pasting
ok, I'll try that. thank you
Im having trouble with the 3D modules for openChrome
Lactymology: ifconfig
hmm...I don't know how to get to the server's location in nautilus. It starts in the filesystem but the server is external and through the network. normally I'd get to it from places -> Network
sudo chown <yourusername> <path to *.doc *odt>
ok, thanks!
gives you ownership, i bet you will be able to move them whereever then, if you have access to move files to the external server aswell
does it work on folders too, or just files?
it should perhaps work on folders aswell
but i guess
ok, great. thanks again!
congrats
uh oh, now it looks like it's gotten stuck while copying. it says "copying files" but it's not doing anything
You sure you have suficient writing access on the external server?

hmm...I dont know, but I think so because I've manager to copy other things to this server, it's just these word files which are giving me a hard time for some reason. how do I check about the access though?

Going to eat now, but try selecting the files in the folder, rightclick, go to properties/Permissions, and select Read and Write, on all groups that should give you full access to the files. If it still dont work, put them in the same folder as the previous files. Or rename their extension, with "mv".. For info on how to use it, check "man mv"
ok, thanks for all the help!
